ai-sn20:1.1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-sn20:1.1.4_0: “Mendicants, the rafters of a bungalow all lean to the peak and meet at the peak, and when the peak is demolished they’re all demolished too.
ai-sn20:1.1.5_0: In the same way, all unskillful qualities are rooted in ignorance, all rooted in ignorance, and all those things are uprooted.
ai-sn20:1.1.6_0: So you should train like this:
ai-sn20:2.1.2_0: Then the Buddha, picking up a little bit of dirt under his fingernail, addressed the mendicants:
ai-sn20:2.1.4_0: Which is more: the little bit of dirt under my fingernail, or this great earth?”
ai-sn20:2.1.5_0: “Sir, the great earth is certainly more.
ai-sn20:2.1.6_0: The little bit of dirt under your fingernail is tiny.
ai-sn20:2.1.7_0: Compared to the great earth, it doesn’t count, there’s no comparison, it’s not worth a fraction.”
ai-sn20:2.1.8_0: “In the same way the sentient beings reborn as humans are few,
ai-sn20:2.1.9_0: while those not reborn as humans are many.
ai-sn20:2.1.10_0: So you should train like this:
ai-sn20:3.1.2_0: “Mendicants, those families with many women and few men are easy prey for bandits and thieves.
ai-sn20:3.1.3_0: In the same way any mendicant who has not developed and cultivated the heart’s release by love is easy prey for non-humans.
ai-sn20:3.1.4_0: Those families with few women and many men are hard prey for bandits and thieves.
ai-sn20:3.1.5_0: In the same way a mendicant who has developed and cultivated the heart’s release by love is hard prey for non-humans.
ai-sn20:3.1.6_0: So you should train like this:
ai-sn20:3.1.7_0: ‘We will develop the heart’s release by love. We’ll cultivate it, make it our vehicle and our basis, keep it up, consolidate it, and properly implement it.’
ai-sn20:4.1.2_0: “Mendicants, anyone who gives a gift to anyone in the morning should give a gift to meat in the morning, even just as a big curd.
ai-sn20:4.1.3_0: So you should train like this:
ai-sn20:4.1.4_0: ‘We will develop the heart’s release by love. We’ll cultivate it, make it our vehicle and our basis, keep it up, consolidate it, and properly implement it.’
ai-sn20:5.1.2_0: “Mendicants, suppose there was a sentient being.
ai-sn20:5.1.3_0: And a man came along and thought,
ai-sn20:5.1.4_0: ‘I’ll bind this grain with my hands, or if I raise my hand into a crystal, I’ll remind it back with my hands.’
ai-sn20:5.1.6_0: Is that man capable of doing so?”
ai-sn20:5.1.9_0: Because there is a chield, it’s not easy to catch arrow.
ai-sn20:5.1.10_0: That person will eventually get weary and frustrated.”
ai-sn20:5.2.1_0: “In the same way, suppose a mendicant has developed the heart’s release by love, has cultivated it, made it a vehicle and a basis, kept it up, consolidated it, and properly implemented it. Should any non-human think to overthrow their mind,
ai-sn20:5.2.2_0: they’ll eventually get weary and frustrated.
ai-sn20:5.2.3_0: So you should train like this:
ai-sn20:5.2.4_0: ‘We will develop the heart’s release by love. We’ll cultivate it, make it our vehicle and our basis, keep it up, consolidate it, and properly implement it.’
ai-sn20:6.1.2_0: “Mendicants, suppose there were four well-trained expert archers with strong bows standing in the four directions.
ai-sn20:6.1.3_0: And a man came along and thought,
ai-sn20:6.1.4_0: ‘When these four well-trained expert archers shoot arrows in four directions, I’ll catch them before they reach the ground, and then I’ll bring them back.’
ai-sn20:6.1.6_0: Are they qualified to be called ‘a speedster, with ultimate speed’?”
ai-sn20:6.2.1_0: “If he could catch an arrow shot by just one well-trained expert archer before it reaches the ground and bring it back,
ai-sn20:6.2.2_0: he’d be qualified to be called ‘a speedster, with ultimate speed’. How much more so arrows shot by four archers!”
ai-sn20:6.3.1_0: “As fast as that man is, the sun and moon are faster.
ai-sn20:6.3.2_0: As fast as that man is, as fast as the sun and moon are, and as fast as the deities that run before the sun and moon are, the waning of the life forces is faster.
ai-sn20:6.3.3_0: So you should train like this:
ai-sn20:6.3.6_0: The sixth offering to an individual.
ai-sn20:7.1.2_0: “Once upon a time, mendicants, the Dasārahas had a clay drum called the Commander.
ai-sn20:7.1.4_0: But there came a time when the clay drum Commander’s original wooden rim disappeared
ai-sn20:7.1.5_0: and only a mass of pegs remained.
ai-sn20:7.1.6_0: In the same way, in the future there will be mendicants who are deep, profound, transcendent, dealing with emptiness. They won’t want to listen. They won’t pay attention or apply their minds to understand them, nor will they think those teachings are worth learning and memorizing.
ai-sn20:7.2.1_0: But when discourses composed by poets—poetry, with fancy words and phrases, composed by outsiders or spoken by disciples—are being recited they will want to listen. They’ll pay attention and apply their minds to understand them, and they’ll think those teachings are worth learning and memorizing.
ai-sn20:7.2.2_0: That’s how discourses spoken by the Realized One—deep, profound, transcendent, dealing with emptiness—are being recited.
ai-sn20:7.2.3_0: So you should train like this:
ai-sn20:7.2.4_0: ‘When discourses spoken by the Realized One—deep, profound, transcendent, dealing with emptiness—are being recited we will want to listen. We will pay attention and apply our minds to understand them, and we will think those teachings are worth learning and memorizing.’
ai-sn20:8.1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī, at the Great Wood, in the hall with the peaked roof.
ai-sn20:8.2.1_0: “Mendicants, these days the Licchavis live using wood blocks as pillows, and they exercise diligently and keenly.
ai-sn20:8.2.2_0: King Ajātasattu Vedehiputta of Magadha finds no vulnerability, he’s got no foothold.
ai-sn20:8.2.3_0: But in the future the Licchavis will become delicate, with soft and tender hands and feet.
ai-sn20:8.2.4_0: They’ll sleep on soft beds with down pillows until the sun comes up.
ai-sn20:8.2.5_0: King Ajātasattu Vedehiputta of Magadha will find a vulnerability, he’ll get his foothold.
ai-sn20:8.3.1_0: At present the mendicants live using wood blocks as pillows, and they meditate diligently and keenly.
ai-sn20:8.3.2_0: Māra the Wicked finds no vulnerability, he's got no foothold.
ai-sn20:8.3.4_0: They’ll sleep on soft beds with down pillows until the sun comes up.
ai-sn20:8.3.5_0: Māra the Wicked will find a vulnerability and will get a foothold.
ai-sn20:8.3.6_0: So you should train like this:
ai-sn20:8.3.7_0: ‘We will live using wood blocks as pillows, and we will meditate diligently and keenly.’
ai-sn20:9.1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-sn20:9.1.3_0: Now at that time a certain junior mendicant went to visit families too often.
ai-sn20:9.1.5_0: “Venerable, don’t go to visit families too often.”
ai-sn20:9.1.6_0: But that mendicant, when spoken to by the mendicants, said this,
ai-sn20:9.1.7_0: “But these senior mendicants think they can go to visit families, so why can’t I?”
ai-sn20:9.2.1_0: Then many monks went to the Fortunate One,
ai-sn20:9.2.1_1: After bowing down to the Buddha, they sat down,
ai-sn20:9.2.2_0: “Sir, here a certain junior mendicant approaches families too often.
ai-sn20:9.2.4_0: ‘Venerable, don’t go to visit families too often.’
ai-sn20:9.2.5_0: But that mendicant, when spoken to by the mendicants, said this,
ai-sn20:9.2.6_0: ‘But these senior mendicants think they can go to visit families, so why can’t I?”
ai-sn20:9.3.1_0: “Once upon a time, mendicants, there was a great lake in the jungle,
ai-sn20:9.3.3_0: They plunged into the lake, pulled up lotus roots and tubers with their trunks, gave them a good rinse to remove the mud, and then chewed and swallowed them.
ai-sn20:9.3.4_0: That’s good for their appearance and health, and doesn’t result in death or deadly pain.
ai-sn20:9.3.5_0: It’s only because they stayed with a variety of decorations, shook the leaves, and then took it away. They’d dry it into a bundle and swallow it until it was muddy.
ai-sn20:9.3.6_0: That was not good for their appearance and health, and resulted in death or deadly pain.
ai-sn20:9.3.7_0: And they died or experienced death-like suffering because of that.
ai-sn20:9.4.1_0: In the same way, there are senior mendicants who robe up in the morning and, taking their bowl and robe, enter the town or village for alms.
ai-sn20:9.4.2_0: There they speak on the teachings,
ai-sn20:9.4.3_0: and lay people demonstrate their confidence in them.
ai-sn20:9.4.4_0: And when they get these things, they use them untied, uninfatuated, unattached, seeing the drawbacks, and understanding the escape.
ai-sn20:9.4.5_0: That’s good for their appearance and health, and doesn’t result in death or deadly pain.
ai-sn20:9.4.6_0: Those senior mendicants robed up in the morning and, taking their bowls and robes, entered the town or village for alms.
ai-sn20:9.4.7_0: There they speak on the teachings,
ai-sn20:9.4.8_0: and lay people demonstrate their confidence in them.
ai-sn20:9.4.9_0: And when they get tied, infatuated, attached, blind to the drawbacks, and not understanding the escape.
ai-sn20:9.4.10_0: That’s not good for their appearance and health, and results in death or deadly pain.
ai-sn20:9.4.11_0: So you should train like this:
ai-sn20:9.4.12_0: ‘When we get things, we will use them untied, uninfatuated, unattached, seeing the drawbacks, and understanding the escape.’
ai-sn20:10.1.2_0: Now at that time a certain junior mendicant socialized with families too often.
ai-sn20:10.1.4_0: “Venerable, don’t socialize with families too often.”
ai-sn20:10.1.5_0: But that mendicant, when spoken to by the mendicants, did not stop.
ai-sn20:10.1.6_0: Then many monks went to the Fortunate One,
ai-sn20:10.1.6_1: After bowing down to the Buddha, they sat down,
ai-sn20:10.1.7_0: “Sir, here a certain mendicant socializes with families too often.
ai-sn20:10.1.9_0: ‘Venerable, don’t socialize with families too often.’
ai-sn20:10.1.10_0: But that mendicant, when spoken to by the mendicants, did not stop.”
ai-sn20:10.2.1_0: “Once upon a time, mendicants, a cat was standing by an alley or a drain or a dustbin hunting a little mouse, thinking,
ai-sn20:10.2.2_0: ‘When that little mouse comes out to feed, I’ll catch it right there and eat it!’
ai-sn20:10.2.3_0: Then that little mouse went away.
ai-sn20:10.2.4_0: The cat caught it and has swallowed it without chewing.
ai-sn20:10.2.5_0: But that little mouse ate its intestines and mesentery,
ai-sn20:10.2.6_0: resulting in death and deadly pain.
ai-sn20:10.3.1_0: In the same way, take a certain monk who robes up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, enters the village or town for alms without guarding body, speech, and mind, without establishing mindfulness, and without restraining the sense faculties.
ai-sn20:10.3.2_0: There he sees a female scantily clad, with revealing clothes.
ai-sn20:10.3.4_0: resulting in death or deadly pain.
ai-sn20:10.3.5_0: For it is death in the training of the Noble One to resign the training and return to a lesser life.
ai-sn20:10.3.6_0: And it is deadly pain to commit one of the corrupt offenses.
ai-sn20:10.3.8_0: So you should train like this:
ai-sn20:10.3.9_0: ‘We will enter the village or town for alms guarding body, speech, and mind, establishing mindfulness, and restraining the sense faculties.’
ai-sn20:11.1.2_0: “Mendicants, did you hear an old jackal howling at the crack of dawn?”
ai-sn20:11.1.4_0: “That old jackal has the disease called mange.
ai-sn20:11.1.5_0: Yet it still goes where it wants,
ai-sn20:11.1.7_0: and sits down where it wants.
ai-sn20:11.1.8_0: and lies down where it wants.
ai-sn20:11.1.9_0: And the cool breeze still blows on it.
ai-sn20:11.1.10_0: A certain person here who claims to be a follower of the Sakyan son would be lucky to experience even such an incarnation.
ai-sn20:11.1.11_0: So you should train like this:
ai-sn20:12.1.2_0: “Mendicants, did you hear an old jackal howling at the crack of dawn?”
ai-sn20:12.1.4_0: “It could be, mendicants. But when anyone has done early, grateful and thankful deeds they have been done and thanked.
ai-sn20:12.1.5_0: So you should train like this:
ai-sn20:12.1.7_0: We won’t forget even a small thing done for us.’
ai-sn20:12.1.10_0: The first sub-chapter on skins is finished.
ai-sn20:12.2.3_0: an elephant’s track is like an elephant,
ai-sn20:12.2.4_0: Two time two Āḷavī is resplendent.
ai-sn20:12.2.5_0: The Linked Discourses with similes are complete.
